intro: Henriettea strigosa, commonly known as the rough-haired daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as its small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head. Henriettea strigosa typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
